title: Segmentation fault when compiling `unicode-bidi` inside Docker

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Not sure if this is a useful bug report or not, but I'm building an `amd64` executable inside Docker on an `aarch64` host (Apple Silicon). `rustc` aborts with a `SIGSEGV` when compiling `unicode-bidi`. I don't have an `amd64` host to test on, so I don't know if this is caused by the oddity of my build environment. I can say I've successfully built project this way that _don't_ use `unicode-bidi`. But I figure any crash is useful to know about. It's easy to reproduce if you have an `aarch64` host. ### Code #### Project Setup ```shell cargo new amd-on-arm --lib cd amd-on-arm cargo add unicode-bidi # Create `Dockerfile` below docker build . ``` #### Build Environment ```Dockerfile FROM --platform=linux/amd64 rust:latest AS builder RUN rustup target add x86_64-unknown-linux-musl RUN apt update && apt install -y musl-tools musl-dev RUN update-ca-certificates COPY ./ . RUN RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build --target x86_64-unknown-linux-musl --release ``` ### Meta ```shell uname -a Darwin MacBook-Pro.local 21.3.0 Darwin Kernel Version 21.3.0: Wed Jan 5 21:37:58 PST 2022; root:xnu-8019.80.24~20/RELEASE_ARM64_T6000 arm64 ``` `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0 (9d1b2106e 2022-02-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9d1b2106e23b1abd32fce1f17267604a5102f57a commit-date: 2022-02-23 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output
